intro: Ditassa surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or swampy areas. It has hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
